item.title: A new report on the Maui wildfires cites communications breakdowns
item.description: As wildfires ripped across Maui last August, a broad communications breakdown left authorities in the dark and residents without emergency alerts, according to a report released Wednesday.

item.title: The Supreme Court opens the door to more discrimination claims involving job transfers
item.description: The U.S. Supreme Court has made it easier for workers to bring employment discrimination suits over job transfers. The decision was unanimous, but the reasoning was not.

item.title: Senate kills articles of impeachment against Homeland Security Secretary Mayorkas
item.description: The Senate rejected the two articles that accuse Mayorkas of refusing to enforce immigration laws. The House voted to impeach him in February.

item.title: Watch: A circus elephant runs loose in a Montana town before being recaptured
item.description: The animal was having a routine bath when she was startled by a truck backfiring and ran away before being recaptured by handlers. Videos of the unexpected sight were shared widely on social media.

item.title: The Debate in Israel Over Who Should Be Required Serve in the Military
item.description: Ultra-Orthodox Israelis have long been exempt from compulsory military service. But the October 7th attack by Hamas and Israel's subsequent military response have brought forward calls for change. The government's decision on whether to end the exemption has major political consequences.

item.title: NBA bans Jontay Porter after gambling probe shows he shared information, bet on games
item.description: The Toronto Raptors player has been banned for life from the NBA after a probe found he disclosed confidential information to sports bettors and bet on games, even betting on the Raptors to lose.
